prompt: <description>Part 1: Long, Thin, Rectangular Prism with a Flat Top and Bottom Construct a long, thin, rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom. This part will be created in four steps: defining the coordinate system, creating a 2D sketch, scaling the sketch, and extruding the sketch to create the 3D model. I. Define the Coordinate System Begin by creating a new coordinate system with the following properties: * Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] (rotate around Z-axis by 90 degrees, X-axis and Y-axis should remain unchanged) * Translation Vector: [0.0, 0.75, 0.0] (move the origin along the positive Y-axis by 0.75 units) II. Create the 2D Sketch Create a new 2D sketch on the X-Y plane of the defined coordinate system. Draw a rectangle as follows: 1. Draw the first line from point (0.0, 0.0) to point (0.0031, 0.0). 2. Draw the second line from point (0.0031, 0.0) to point (0.0031, 0.0306). 3. Draw the third line from point (0.0031, 0.0306) to point (0.0, 0.0306). 4. Draw the fourth line from point (0.0, 0.0306) to point (0.0, 0.0). III. Scale the Sketch Apply a uniform scale transformation to the sketch using a scaling factor of 0.0306 to change the dimensions of the rectangle to the desired size. IV. Extrude the Sketch Extrude the scaled 2D sketch along the Z-axis to generate the 3D model. Use the following properties: 1. Extrude Depth Towards Normal (Z-axis): 0.75 2. Extrude Depth Opposite Normal (Z-axis): 0.0 This will create the desired long, thin, rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom, with the following dimensions: * Length: 0.0306 * Width: 0.75 * Height: 0.0306</description>
completion:

{"parts":{"part_1":{"coordinate_system":{"Euler Angles":[0.0,0.0,-90.0],"Translation Vector":[0.0,0.75,0.0]},"sketch":{"face_1":{"loop_1":{"line_1":{"Start Point":[0.0,0.0],"End Point":[0.0031,0.0]},"line_2":{"Start Point":[0.0031,0.0],"End Point":[0.0031,0.0306]},"line_3":{"Start Point":[0.0031,0.0306],"End Point":[0.0,0.0306]},"line_4":{"Start Point":[0.0,0.0306],"End Point":[0.0,0.0]}}}},"extrusion":{"extrude_depth_towards_normal":0.75,"extrude_depth_opposite_normal":0.0,"sketch_scale":0.0306,"operation":"NewBodyFeatureOperation"}}}}
</json>

prompt: <description>**Part 1 Instructions** Construct a cylindrical object with a tapered end, resembling a tube or pipe. **Step 1: Create a new coordinate system** Create a new coordinate system at the origin with no rotation or translation. This will serve as the reference for our first part. **Step 2: Draw a 2D sketch** Begin a new sketch on the X-Y plane. Draw a circle centered at (0.0938, 0.0938) with a radius of 0.0938. This will form the base of the cylindrical part. **Step 3: Scale the 2D sketch** Apply a scaling factor of 0.1875 to the entire sketch. This will adjust the size of the circle to the desired dimensions. **Step 4: Transform the scaled 2D sketch into 3D Sketch** Using the coordinate system's euler angles and translation vector, transform the scaled 2D sketch into 3D space. In this case, there is no rotation or translation. **Step 5: Extrude the 2D sketch** Extrude the circle along the Z-axis by 0.75 units, creating a cylindrical object. This completes the first part of the assembly. **Part 1 Details** Part 1 is a cylindrical object with the following dimensions: * Height: 0.75 * Width: 0.1875 * Length: 0.1875 **Part 2 Instructions** Construct a cylindrical object with a slightly tapered top and bottom, resembling a tube or pipe with a section cut out from the top. **Step 1: Create a new coordinate system** Create a new coordinate system at the origin with no rotation around the X and Y axes, and a rotation of 180 degrees around the Z-axis. Translate the coordinate system by (0.0656, 0.1219, 0) to position it correctly. **Step 2: Draw a 2D sketch** Begin a new sketch on the X-Y plane. Draw a circle centered at (0.0281, 0.0281) with a radius of 0.0281. This will form the base of the cylindrical part. **Step 3: Scale the 2D sketch** Apply a scaling factor of 0.0562 to the entire sketch. This will adjust the size of the circle to the desired dimensions. **Step 4: Transform the scaled 2D sketch into 3D Sketch** Using the coordinate system's euler angles and translation vector, transform the scaled 2D sketch into 3D space. In this case, there is no rotation or translation. **Step 5: Extrude the 2D sketch** Extrude the circle along the negative Z-axis by 0.375 units, creating a cylindrical object. Then, perform a cut feature operation on the cylindrical object using the same circle, this time extruding it along the positive Z-axis by 0.375 units. This will remove the top section of the cylindrical object, creating a tapered effect. **Part 2 Details** Part 2 is a cylindrical object with a tapered top and bottom, resembling a tube or pipe with a section cut out from the top. The dimensions are as follows: * Height: 0.375 * Width: 0.0563 * Length: 0.0563</description>
